title: Crashing In Champ Select
body:
Yesterday and all this week the game and everything was working perfectly fine. Today I open the game and join a normal queue. When it was time for the second pair of people to pick, my client froze and I ended up closing the client through task manager and re opening it. After waiting out the 5 min queue timer, I get into another champ select and the same exact thing happens. Both crashes happened when red side got their first picks (blue side already first picked and red side gets next 2). I'm not really annoyed at the timer, don't know if it affects honor level, if it does that sucks, I'm mainly annoyed that I can't play the game. Please if someone knows a solution for this please help.

EDIT: I did uninstall a lot of programs and deleted files, this probably has something to do with it, but I don't really understand why it would. All I did was uninstall Portal games and some songs and memes, I didn't touch anything related to League. I did a defrag afterwards and turned off my PC for a while before turning it back on. Everything besides League is running a lot faster.

replies.body: That's pretty frustrating, so I don't recommend queuing up for more games until we get this figured out.  I could use some more info, though.  When you say crash, what is happening exactly?  Are you getting any error message and what does it say?

The timer you get everytime, for marking the champion you want to play, banning etc. Gets stuck at 0. If you're Lucky you get reconnected to the client if not wel gg. As a software engineer I find it really sad to see this problem still existing today. I've had had this since seasons ago.

Sad.
I managed to fix it, still wondering if dodges affect honor progress.
Aha!  Glad to hear all is well now.  A [queue dodge](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751844-Queue-Dodging) will impact lower priority queue, but your honor should remain okay!
I just re installed it and it works now. There was no error message, just froze. Thanks for the help though.
